text: Eighty-six or 86 is U.S. English slang. It means to get rid of by refusing to serve. When an establishment does not want to let you in, and wants to get rid of you, it gives an excuse, such as: *We're all out of that *30 bucks for entrance In gang language: *He was 86'd (= he was murdered) In rhyming language: *It rhymes with nix, and means the same thing. == References == Category:English language Category:Slang
title: 86 (term)
